intro: Avenula pratensis var. gonzaloi, commonly known as the Gonzalo's meadow sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments such as meadows and wetlands. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the sedge family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
